intro: Corunastylis citriodora, commonly known as the lemon-scented grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. Its leaves emit a distinctive lemony fragrance when crushed, a trait that contributes to its common name. Corunastylis citriodora is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
